Timbs, John

Nooks and Corners of English Life, Past and Present

London: Griffith and Farran, 1867. First edition. Hardcover. 8vo. [3], v-xii, [1], 2-371, [1] (pages of publisher's advertisements), [4] pp. Half late ninteenth-century leather over marbled boards, spine lettered in gold with top edge gilt and a silk green bookmark. Marbled endpapers and pastedowns. Illustrated by a frontispiece and a few additional plates. Plates are drawings depicting the historical and cultural scenes Timbs describes. Historical moments from the English Civil War, the Roman occuaption of England, medieval England, and England in the ninteenth century are described. The manners and customs of the English people are also detailed in this volume, with a discussion on the lives of English peasants. Very Good. Item #00009260

A Very Good copy with three tiny insect holes (total) to the joints with minor rubbing to the boards' corners.

Price: $125.00

See all items in Classical Antiquity, History
